intro: Scaevola kahanae, commonly known as the Kahanae fanflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that resemble small fans. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers come in shades of pink and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scaevola kahanae is considered a rare and endangered species.
